item.description:
Tasca has been a favorite spot for many years. Parking is very tough but they have valet service, and are accessible by T:

MBTA Green Line, B Washington Street Stop

Here's their blurb:

Spanish Wine Tasting Dinner: On Tuesday, April 22nd, Kim (general manager) and Dan (owner) of Tasca will be hosting this five course white table-cloth event. This wine dinner is unlike others in Boston, you will be seated with your reserved party only. We will be personally visiting each table with the wines, rather than lecturing the group. As usual we will be pouring lesser known boutique Spanish Wines. The dinner will start at 7pm and costs $49 per person. A vegetarian option is also available for each course, upon request.

Selection of savory bites
Marques de Gelida, Brut Reserva, 2003

Fresh Mussel soup with with grilled herbed tostados
Las Brisas, Rueda, 2006

Grilled Brie with a warm savory apple and quince chutney
Fuego, Old Vines Garnacha, Calatayud, 2006

Madiera braised Cornish game hen served on a bed of exotic spring mushrooms
Juan Gil, Monastrell, Jumilla, 2005

Grand Marnier drunken strawberries with a Spanish chocolate granache
Jorge Ordonez, Moscatel Selecci√≥n Especial, Malaga, 2005

http://www.tascaresta...
item.how_to_find_us: Ask for me or the Meetup group. Or find our smiling faces.
item.why: Tasca delivers high-quality tapas in an intimate and enchanting setting. They also have some good wines and sangria. Well worth a visit! This is a little different, a wine dinner, and it looks to be a good value.
item.name: Tasca Wine Dinner
